It does not include equity (stock) compensation, cash value of retirement benefits, or the value of other non-cash benefits (e.g. healthcare). ) $15,044 - $22,528 Country: United States | Currency: USD | Updated: 8 Jul 2012 | Individuals Reporting: 3,872

People with the job title Cashier typically fall into one of the following PayScale standard occupations. Cashiers Process sales, bag merchandise and collect money. Close and balance cash drawers. See Sample Job Descriptions for All Jobs

Follow Us On: The latest career advice from people with this job: Cashier Jobs Being a great cashier Cashier - (City withheld for privacy), North Carolina, United States I have been a cashier for various fast food restaurants and department stores. Salary usually starts at minimum, but is usually dependent on experience. I was a manager for a restaurant and we based salary on experience. Those who learned quickly and did their job well were given raises quickly. Posted in Dream Job on 5 Dec 2008 Pay Rate Cashier - (City withheld for privacy), Hawaii, United States I think that i am under pay because i have all this experience background. All new associates that recently got hired before the holidays were getting $10.40 an hour, and it's just so unfair that i was started out at a rate of $8.40 in 2004. So now for 2 years of working for this company, i am only making $9.60 an hour. Posted in Fair Pay on 21 Jan 2007 Success in the job-market Cashier - (City withheld for privacy), Illinois, United States First of all, you need to have the knowledge and the patience it takes to be a good cashier. When you work with the public, you must know how to carry on a polite,but yet professional conversation with every customer you deal with. If you cannot deal with people in general, then you should not be working as a cashier. Posted in Job Search on 7 Jan 2007 Read More Advice
